intro: Macrolobium unifoliolatum var. schultesii, commonly known as the Schultesi's single-leaf macrolobium, is a rare and unique species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive, single leaflet that is often broad and ovate in shape. The plant typically grows in tropical or subtropical environments, preferring well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. Its botanical features include a woody stem with a smooth, sometimes reddish bark. This variant is of particular interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique morphological traits.
